__NOTOC__ {{Infobox scientist | name = Mike Cafarella | image = Mike Cafarella - Ann Arbor Bowling Champion.jpg | image_size = 150px | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[New York City]], [[New York]] | death_date = | death_place = | residence = | citizenship = | nationality = | ethnicity = | field = [[Computer Science]] | work_institution = [[University of Michigan]] | alma_mater = [[University of Washington]], [[University of Edinburgh]], [[Brown University]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Dan Suciu]] | doctoral_students = | known_for = [[Hadoop]], [[Nutch]] | author_abbreviation_bot = | author_abbreviation_zoo = | prizes = | religion = | footnotes = }}
'''Mike Cafarella''' is a [[computer scientist]] specializing in [[database management system]]s. He is currently a [[professor]] of [[computer science]] at [[University of Michigan]].<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.cs.washington.edu/research/projects/ai6/eadar/cafarella-biosketch.doc | title = Biographical Sketch: Michael J. Cafarella | year = 2009 | publication-date = 2009-09-14 | accessdate = 2013-02-01 }} </ref> Along with [[Doug Cutting]], he is one of the original co-founders of the [[Hadoop]] and [[Nutch]] open-source projects.<ref> {{cite journal | last1 = Cafarella | first1 = Mike | last2 = Cutting | first2 = Doug | title = Building Nutch: Open Source Search | journal = ACM Queue | month = April | year = 2004 | volume = 2 | number = 2 | pages = 54â€“61 | url = http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/988392.988408 | issn = 1542-7730 }}</ref><ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.zdnet.com/blog/open-source/cutting-out-for-cloudera-just-in-time/4627 | title = Cutting out for Cloudera just in time | first = Dana | last = Blankenhorn | year = 2009 | publication-date = 2009-08-11 | accessdate = 2013-02-01 }} </ref> Cafarella was born in [[New York City]] and but moved to [[Westwood,_Massachusetts| Westwood, MA]] early in his childhood. After completing his bachelors degree at [[Brown University]], he earned a Ph.D. specializing in database management system at the [[University of Washington]] under [[Dan Suciu]] and [[Oren Etzioni]].<ref> {{cite web | url = https://www.eecs.umich.edu/eecs/etc/fac/facsearchform.cgi?michjc+ | title = Michael J. Cafarella Faculty Information | year = 2013 | accessdate = 2013-02-01 }} </ref> He was also involved in several notable start-ups, including [[Tellme Networks]].<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.yatedo.com/p/Michael+Cafarella/famous/2dfe33ebb25a12c7a4d7436383edb13f | title = Michael Cafarella - Tellme Networks | year = 2002 | accessdate = 2013-02-09 }} </ref>
Prof. Cafarella is known for his smooth, [[baritone]] speaking voice.<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GMFHiCKg5J0 | title = EECSatUM Profile - Prof. Michael Cafarella | publication-date = 2012-08-28 | accessdate = 2013-02-13 }} </ref>
==Education==
* Ph.D., Computer Science, June 2009. [[University of Washington]]. * M.Sc., Computer Science, 2005. [[University of Washington]]. * M.Sc., Artificial Intelligence, 1997. [[University of Edinburgh]]. * B.S., Computer Science, 1996. [[Brown University]].
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://web.eecs.umich.edu/~michjc/ Personal web page] * [http://www.eecs.umich.edu/db/ Michigan Database Group home page]
